ygData.subject: Re: TWINKING-- a discussion
ygData.msgSnippet: I like that idea of You are not experienced enough to use that item. It might be hard to implement, however, as with that Dwarven ring mail. I was something
ygData.messageBody:
I like that idea of "You are not experienced
enough to use that item." It might be hard to implement,
however, as with that Dwarven ring mail. I was something
like 3rd level at the time, and there's only one place
to get it, if I'm not mistaken -- Emperor Crush in
Crushbone. He's about 20th level, I think, so there's no way
I was going to get that on my own. But if someone
wants to give it to me, why prevent that? That's one of
the cool parts of EQ -- the community. I was
completely blown away for my first week at how nice people
were in the game; one Dwarf gave me 7 pp to outfit
myself. Yow! (Now that I think of it, when I lost that
armor, some halfling gave me a Snakeskin Jerkin; kind of
a cool thing. Why do people keep giving me
stuff?)<br><br>But it would prevent same-account twinking, so maybe
that would just be the price to pay.<br><br>Shooman in
a later post makes a point I guess I could accept
-- if you're not going to use something anyway, why
not give it to one of your other characters? I've
thought of that when I get a 2H weapon that my Rogue
can't use, but I'm going to try not to do it.
<br><br><br>"EQ attracts a horny crowd" -- ? Well, yah -- most of
us _are_ computer geeks, you know. The study I
mentioned in an earlier post found that, apart from the
largest group of players (students, 30-odd percent), the
next largest group came from the technical/computer
field (something like 27%). Sheesh, one guy even tried
to hit on my female Troll Shadow Knight -- said to
be careful and not to mess up my "purdy" face . .
.<br><br>Anyway, time to go to Norrath. Good hunting to all of
you.<br><br>Kharlisht of Kaladim<br>10th season Rogue<br>Drinal
